extends org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin
implements org.bukkit.event.Listener

    • Method Detail

      • checkModuleYmlFiles

        private void checkModuleYmlFiles()
                          throws DunGen.ConfigException
        Checks the yml existence and keys for all module names listed in config.yml. This way, the keys don't have to be checked in every loadConfig() function throuhout the plugin.
        Throws:
        DunGen.ConfigException

      • genEntry

        public void genEntry(org.bukkit.util.Vector start,
                     Helper.Direc towardsD)
        Starts the dungeon, generating the entry area and setting up listeners for player button press actions. The STARTUP status will lead to the execution of the startup() member as soon as the entry's button is pressed.
        Parameters:
        start - Vector where the dungeon entry is generated
        towardsD - Dungeon Entry direction

      • genNextRoom

        public void genNextRoom()
        Callback of the switch in each Passageway. Pressed in curPassageWay2 after completing a room. Generates the next room after the previous was finished. It is therefore called by the onButtonPress event listener within the passageWays.

      • getRandomModule

        public java.lang.String getRandomModule(java.util.List<java.lang.String> type)
        Chooses a module name from the given List semi-randomly, according to the current seed.
        Parameters:
        type - String-List of a certain module type.
        Returns:
        A name string of the chosen module.

      • loadConfig

        private void loadConfig()
                 throws DunGen.ConfigException
        Loads the standard configuration file of the plugin, config.yml. Also checks the module lists contain entries.
        Throws:
        DunGen.ConfigException

      • giveStartingGear

        private void giveStartingGear(org.bukkit.entity.Player p)
        Gives the players starting gear, called during dungeon startup.
        Parameters:
        p - The player to give stuff to.

      • onCommand

        public boolean onCommand(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                         org.bukkit.command.Command cmd,
                         java.lang.String label,
                         java.lang.String[] args)
        Checks command strings and acts upon found commands. Called by the server.
        Specified by:
        onCommand in interface org.bukkit.command.CommandExecutor
        Overrides:
        onCommand in class org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin

      • onDisable

        public void onDisable()
        Shutdown operations, called by the server.
        Specified by:
        onDisable in interface org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin
        Overrides:
        onDisable in class org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin

      • onEnable

        public void onEnable()
        Booting of the plugin, called by the server upon start. We set up directories, the config and do general checks.
        Specified by:
        onEnable in interface org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin
        Overrides:
        onEnable in class org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin

      • onPlayerRespawn

        public void onPlayerRespawn(org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerRespawnEvent event)
        Handles actions to be taken upon respawn. Currently gives new starting gear.

      • reset

        private void reset()
        This should be called when the plugin is in ERROR state to reset it to a hopefully working state.

      • resetActivePlayers

        private void resetActivePlayers()
        Resets the players to how they were before they entered the dungeon.

      • roomClear

        public void roomClear()
        Callback of the room task checking for victory conditions in each normal dungeon room.

      • setStateAndNotify

        public void setStateAndNotify(DunGen.State state,
                              java.lang.String message)
        Sets the plugins status with a message. Used for control flow and signalizing errors. This overload also prints the message to the console.
        Parameters:
        state - The state to be set.
        message - The message to be written to console, e.g. an error message.

      • setStateSilenty

        private void setStateSilenty(DunGen.State state)
        Overloaded set state function with empty message as default parameter.
        Parameters:
        state - The state to set.

      • setStateSilenty

        private void setStateSilenty(DunGen.State state,
                             java.lang.String message)
        Overloaded set state function with the given message. Does not print to console.
        Parameters:
        state - The state to set.

      • startDungeon

        private void startDungeon(org.bukkit.entity.Player p)
        Dungeon activation function called when a player gives the /start command. Calls the genEntry() function at that players position.
        Parameters:
        p - The player that gave the /start command.

      • startup

        private void startup()
        Called when the first button within the entry Module was just pushed Takes appropriate startup actions and then sets the state to RUNNING.

      • stopDungeon

        private void stopDungeon()
        Stops the dungeon in any state, resetting the players and modules. Will also try to reset the plugin if it is in error state.
